item.title: Insomnia
item.description:
Insomnia is the fast, beautiful API client that makes testing REST and GraphQL APIs a pleasure. Built by Kong, it combines a clean interface with powerful features that developers actually use.

## Key Features
- Beautiful Interface: Clean, intuitive design that doesn’t get in your way
- Environment Variables: Switch between dev, staging, and production instantly
- GraphQL Support: First-class GraphQL with schema fetching and autocomplete
- Request Collections: Organize APIs into workspaces and folders
- Code Generation: Generate code snippets in 12+ languages
- Plugin System: Extend functionality with custom plugins

## Why Developers Choose Insomnia
Insomnia hits the sweet spot between simplicity and power.

item.title: Postman
item.description: Postman is the world’s leading API platform, used by over 25 million developers to design, test, and document APIs more efficiently. What started as a simple Chrome extension has evolved into the complete platform for API development, making it easier to build and consume APIs at every stage of the development lifecycle. Complete API lifecycle management: Design - Define API schemas and specifications with OpenAPI support Test - Send requests, validate responses, and automate testing scenarios Document - Generate beautiful, always up-to-date API documentation Monitor - Track API performance and uptime in production Mock - Create mock servers for frontend development before backend is ready Key features:

item.title: Swagger
item.description: Swagger transforms API development through its comprehensive open-source framework that enables teams to design, document, and generate client libraries for REST APIs using the OpenAPI Specification, providing a standardized approach to API development that ensures consistency, discoverability, and maintainability across diverse development projects and organizational boundaries. This influential platform excels at API-first development through its design tools that allow developers to define API specifications before implementation, while its code generation capabilities automatically create client SDKs, server stubs, and interactive documentation that reduces development time and ensures consistency between API specifications and actual implementations.
